summary:
> LINK Â· 'Limits of Language' by Field Music on Bandcamp
The news of another album from the Brewis brothers comes around once every two years and is always something to look forward to.  They remind me of a McCartney II sort of Paul McCartney - a bit experimental, mostly straight pop songs, way better than they're given credit for
title: > New music from Field Music!

summary:
> LINK Â· 'The Disappearing Water Magic Trick' on The Spruce Crafts
On a recent episode of Bob's Burgers, a character mentions a trick using something that's used in diapers. 
For the curious, it's sodium polyacrylate, a largely-harmless compound that is ultra-absorbent and can make water solidify almost instantly.  It's very cheap to purchase and a fun trick to do (when it goes right)...
title: > Doing magic with sodium polyacrylate

summary:
During the course of May this year I took part in WeblogPoMo2024, a challenge to write a little bit on as many days as possible. 
I chose a theme - why I stopped using a particular Tumblr account that I'm really fond of in retrospect - and soon my posts became a weird examination of my own happiness over time.  Having a blog, I said, is a way to express joy, especially when posts link to brilliant content from other people...
title: Moving blogs all over again

summary: Coinbase responds to campaign finance violation allegations, Trump panders to bitcoiners, and I chat with Lyn Alden about sexism in bitcoin.

summary: Discovering a city by wandering and following your instincts can make you feel like a local in no time
title: The Art of Wandering

summary: I've been trying to bounce around different search engines lately since they all have their disadvantages, and only just realized the other month that Google has a version of it's search engine without the AI and junk.  I first found on udm14. com which linked to another site to explain it all...
title: Google "Web" Results Only for Firefox

summary: In January, KrebsOnSecurity wrote about rapper Punchmade Dev, whose music videos sing the praises of a cybercrime lifestyle.  That story showed how Punchmade's social media profiles promoted Punchmade-themed online stores selling bank account and payment card data.  Now the Kentucky native is suing his financial institution after it blocked a $75,000 wire transfer and froze his account, citing an active law enforcement investigation
title: Cybercrime Rapper Sues Bank over Fraud Investigation

summary: When the best blog topics come to me in the most inopportune times
title: The Muse That Keeps Getting Away

summary:
Yesterday, R.  Scott Jones shared his latest project, Blog Prompts.  I decided to give it a try and picked the following suggestion:

Write a blog post about whether you lean more towards being a planner, or would rather "go with the flow," and why...
title: Embracing the Unexpected
